text: Bra smakkaraktär - fler noter inkl lite kola. Passar väl in i smakidealet för typen.
It felt powerful in strength and in flavour but still subtle enough to be a good old premium bitter. Really enjoyed it.

Many thanks to Niache/Hackobock/FatPhil for this one (Im too confused as to which is from which now). Not what I would call a pale ale, like the bottle does, but quite good. Tastes closer to an EAB with some brown ale characteristics. A little sweetness to go with the malts. Some back end hops. Nice. A sweet caramel in the nose and body.

Bärnstensfärgad. Maltig smak med lite toffee. Lite för lätt en en bra matöl

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2016 Backlog, early amateur rating! @ Havregatan 201210xx. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity, sweet, light hoppy.

January 24, 2016. Bottle, best before March 18, 2016. 
Clear dark amber with a medium sized beige head. Aroma is malty with toffee, hints of chocolate, dark bread, light hoppy orange notes. 
Taste is light to medium sweet, malty, roast and light bitter. Finish is light to medium bitter,light roasted, chocolate, sweet toffee notes, dark bread, hints of licorice, light hoppy with floral and orange notes. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation. 
Solid malty bitter.
500ml bottle. Dark copper body with a medium head. Fruity, malty and a bit spicy, with finishing herbsl notes.
Bottle 0.5l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is ruby red with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, bitterness, dryness, fruits and malts.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget, Söderhallarna. Clear amber with a beautiful creamy off-white head, really nice looking pour. Caramel aroma with sweet dark fruit and toffee. Dry mouthfeel, medium bodied. Taste is fruity with plum, figs, ripe red apple, caramel. Finish dry with bitterness and nuts.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Amber colour with a large off-white head.
Aroma: Hops, fruit, caramel.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet malt, citrus, caramel, some oranges.

Klar brun med høyt beige skum som legger seg fort. Overraskende noe sur lukt med noe karamell. Søt syrlig smak av epler, bær og karamell, kandissukker. Fyldig. Medium kullsyre. Sitter igjen med bittersyrlig smak.

Flaska från Systembolaget , jag gillar den, en riktigt god Bitter på det där kärva torra sättet!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown low head
Aromas and taste of butterscotch, roasted malts, caramel
Aroma of roast, caramel and dms. The taste is caramel, bread, roast and dms. Quite avarage.

Auf der Flasche als "Stark pale ale" bezeichnet. Schöne dunkelbraune Farbe mit stabilem weißem Schaum. Der Geruch ist pale-ale typisch und leicht malzig. Im Antrunk ist es frisch, etwas wässrig und angenehm herb. Der Hauptteil ist leicht säuerlich und immer noch etwas flach. Erst im Nachgeschmack wird das Bier vollmundig-süffig und schön malzig-röstmalzig. Es tauchen neben der ale-typischen herbe Säuerlichkeit auch angenehme espresso-röstmalztöne auf. Auf der Zunge bleibt dieser Eindruck mittellang erhalten. 
--> ein sehr leckeres, aber erst zum Ende hin aromenreiches Bier. Sehr angenehm zu trinken!


Test vom 30.9.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,10,10,12,12,11 - 11,00

500 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Clear amber with small white head. Aroma is sweet with caramel, malt, biscuit, fruit and some buttery notes. Taste wit malt, wood, diacetyl with good hop notes. Nice beer

Pours clear reddish amber with a finger of thick white head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, hay, ripe dark fruit. Taste is light sweet and bitter at first, before the bitterness builds up towards the finish. Body is light and crisp with soft to average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My goodness what a wonderful beer. Wonderful very scent that you never want to stop smelling. The taste is really good too after getting the husband to hang around long long in the mouth. I really love this brewery. Theres something special about their beers. Follow me @ Kung av öl / King of Beer @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Sveriges i särklass godaste och fruktigaste ale, lång eftersmak, helt perfekt, en ny favorit.
Amber colour, low carbonation. Malty taste with caramel notes. A bit hoppy with a slightly bitter finish

Dark copper color, very low carbonation. 
Nice malty taste with some spices on the aftertaste. 
Nothing impressive but for sure a beer above average.
Pours dark copper colour. Nice body, not to hoppy slight slight bitter finish. Ok beer.

500 ml bottle. 11361-01. BB 12/12. (Systembolaget) Östersund, Sweden.
Clear amber colour with small white head.
Sweet aroma of caramel malt, biscuit, mild hops and mild touch of butter. 
Malt in flavour. Woody dryness, butter sweetness, some bitter hops and some darkness. Hmm... not bad at all.
Bottle. Dark brown, low offwhite head. Heavy malt aroma with caramel, roast, light hoppy notes. Sweet malty taste with a bitter hoppy finish.
50cl, Swedish brew, from Systembolaget Göteborg, complex brew, malty/fruity and slightly bitter/vinous, balanced, clear, small head, good brew

Bottle. Amber brown with a rather dull head. This beer is more English than many ales from England. Strong bready and caramelly malt, toffee, raisins, strawberries and ripe apples, a hint of butterscotch and strong hops - citrusy, floral and resiny. Quaffable just as it should be, with a full malty body, fruity-caramelly flavour and a moderately strong, earthy and resiny bitterness. What more could you want from an English ale? Nicely done!

Bottle from Systembolaget Gårda
Amber color, nice foam
Médium boda & complexity
Well integrated hops and distinct lingering bitterness
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50 cl bottle.
Rated on 20110605.
Pours dark, clear copper color with small, lasting head. Aroma of hops, resin and fruits. Flavor of fruits and mild malts.
3413

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear dark amber with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of nutty malts, faint hops in the background. Taste is light burnt and roasted malts, sweet caramel, with a good bitter and chewy end. Good beer.

Bottle. Deep coppery amber body, small off-white head. Nose is grainy caramel malt tones, bubble gum and hints of nuts. Taste is caramel, toast, bubble gum, hints of cellar must and malt sugars. Easy-going, light palate. Very drinkable, but a bit sweet. A pretty decent ESB.
Rather smokey and roasty, full flavoured and distinctly British hopwise. Looks murky and is brownish in colour.

An old favorite since 15 years, but quite some time since last. Pours reddish brown, dense high foam. Honey aroma. Rather sweet, roasted taste, hints of chocolate. Malty, moderate bitterness. Soon disappearing from standard range at Systembolaget, therefore needed to sample it again.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Nu är jag kanske part i målet eftersom jag är jämtlänning och före detta brevbärare, men jag tar mig ändå friheten att döma Jämtlands Postiljon till livstids närvaro i mitt barskåp. Den har haft uppenbart uppsåt och inte visat någon som helst hänsyn när den levererat smakupplevelser. Domen kan inte överklagas.

Mycket trevlig arom av honung, vanilj och fruktighet. I smaken finner man även där honung men också grapefrukt. För ett ännu högre betyg hade den behövt större tyngd, nu är den något tunn i eftersmaken. Men jag lär säkert köpa den igen, för den var på det stora hela inte dum alls.
Bottled: pours; darkred, brownish/copper. Smells: bitter,sweet, abit citrus. Tastes: bitter, roasted nuts and a taint of honey.
Bottled. Pours wine red with a big light brown head. Smells bitter malty and abit barry. Tastes creamy bitter with a clear bitter finish.
Bottle. Deep amber colour with a tan head. Rich malty and fruity nose. Floral hoppy flavour with a fine malty background. Lots of fruitiness ass well

Jämtlands Postiljon Extra Strong Pale Ale
<a href="http://www.jamtlandsbryggeri.se/page112 target="_blank" rel="nofollow">www.jamtlandsbryggeri. 2010-10-30 & 2011-11-11

Härlig svensk ale från Jämtlands Bryggeri med doft av rostad malt, karamell, smör, torkad frukt & apelsinskal.
Alkoholhalten är på 5.8%.
Smak med stor beska, rostad ton, fyllig & lång eftersmak.
Mörkbrun färg med fint skum.
Köp & njut!
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Burned caramel and some coffee. Heavy needle notes in the aftertaste.
Dark brown color with a medium size beige head. Dry pale ale that lack hop flavor, a little foolish bitterness.
Brödig till tusan är det första näsan registrerar...därefter lite anis. Smakar som den luktar...ölen är komplex och har mycket att berätta..som - köp mig igen o.s.v. =)...och JA det ska jag fan göra.

500 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on December 13. Pours deep amber with a light brown fizzy head that leaves some trace while dissipating. Smell is malty sweet with caramel, wood, some smoke and lemon zest. Taste is slightly sweet and slightly bitter with caramel, butterscotch, lemon zest and some metal. Finish is slightly sweet with caramel.

Nose is sour earth, gingerbread, cinnamon, weak soap, feel is mediumweak, carb Is medium, taste is medium bittersweet hops bite, weak rosehip, some leaves, velvet, sweet malt, stale cola sweetness, later weak sweetish bile,
dark brown black coloured body with a little off white head a spicy hoppy malty aroma a spicy malty caramel fruity bitter taste with a spicy bitter finish

Bottle. Pours a dark brownish color with red notes and a off white head. Aroma is of toasted malt, caramel, marmalade, toffee, buttery notes and lots of fruity esters. The flavor follows the nose with the lightly toasted malt, caramel, fruity esters from the yeast with flavors of currents, red berries and marmalade, I also get the buttery and toffee notes. The body is medium with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty solid ESB!

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 08/2011. Rated on 05.06.2011
Aroma is somewhat fruity with sweetish malt and toffee. Flavour has toffee, sweetish malt and some hops. Feels very british. Good.
Bottle, pours red/amber with off white head. Aroma is fruits, malt, nuts, hops. Taste is medium bitterness. Medium body and carbon. Good beer

500 ml bottle in Germany with much thanks to omhper. Pours a maple syrup like color, semi-see through and a very thin tan head. Aroma of citrus, wood and nuts. Dry hoppy palalte. Good Brew other than the over baring dryness at the end.

Bottle courtesy of omhper (thanks!). Porued a dark amber-brown body with a big, thick off white head, slow. Sweet, malt-driven, light, creamy, slightly cardboardy but hardly bad nose. Light malty taste, creamy, slightly acidic hopiness, all round well formed malt profile, maybe some aroma hop - vague orangey notes. Not bad, a bit random and Ive expected a bit more.
Clear dark reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 140911

Minnet sviker mig kanske - det vore inte första gången i så fall, bedrägliga odåga - men jag handlar i god tro när jag säger att Postiljon var min första kontakt med Jämtlands bryggeri. Vad jag däremot minns med detaljskärpa, som om upplevelsen dokumenterats i hd-upplösning, är den sensation som ölet väckte - som om en helt ny horisont uppenbarat sig. Riktigt så subversiv upplever jag den inte i dag, men minnet sitter  kvar - som en tagg som med åren blivit en del av kroppen.

Enligt etiketten en stark pale ale. Skulle snarare säga kastanjefärgad än pale men visst. Brödig maltdoft, men även en närvaro av engelsk humle. Till smaken väldigt fylligt brödig, viss sötma, len färskölskaraktär, blommig engelsk humle och vilket skiljer den från sina engelska special bitter förlagor en ganska stor beska.
Bottle 50 cl. A brown orange colour with a small beige head. An aroma of roasted malt, caramel and hops. The taste is mild sweet. A medium body, oily texture, average carbonation and a sweet finish.
Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Brown amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy spicey aroma. Moderate bitter flaor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. Nice.

Bottle. From notes.
Dark amber to brown, with a beige head.
Malty, nutty, fruity, medium bitter.
Pretty nice.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a dark mahogany colour with a frothy white head. Aroma of toasted nuts with some light honey. Flavour of toasted nuts, dried fruits, malts, hops, toffee and some light honey. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and a fruity finish. Enjoyable.

One of my favorites, a big and bold taste good with food or just enjoy this beer just becouse its a great beer. I the the color is perfect. This is a fresh beer and as all Jämtlands beer it has a Jämtland signature taste..

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2012 Bottle. Clear chestnut colour, beige head. Aroma is roasted malt with butterscotch. Taste is first a bit sweet and fruity with oranges, apricot and sweet red berries then goes quite dry and bitter with some tobacco and coffee. Medium body, nice carbonation, a bit sticky.

08.01.2011. 0,5l Bottle. From Systembolaget Charlottenberg. Pale brown colour with white head. Clear. Very nice smooth aroma. Malty and good bitterness. There is both aromatic hops and bitterness that gives this beer a lasting aftertaste. Medium to full bodied beer. Very good.

nice balanced head on pour. dark in colour, not black though, a bit darkish brown, rusty in colour.clear hops aromas on the nose. almost sweet, citrus-like. makes me think of american hops at first, but the murkiness takes me back to english pub ales. good mouth feel, not that full, but a lot of taste. very enjoyable. blindly i would say this is hobgoblin ale, a bit surprised that something this good in this style would come from sweden. An english-ale style beer with a bit of murkiness.

Bottled 500ml. -Dark amber coloured, medium sized off-white head, lemony hoppy nose. Slight roasted malt, heavy hoppy and jam like fruity taste. Touch of caramel in rather bitter hoppy finish. A bit watery but all in all well balanced and pleasant beer.

Poured murky, brown color and a tan, small, lacing head. Roasted aroma with fruity hints of plum, red grapes, and hops. Sweet taste in a lgiht body and medium carbonation. Sweet taste with a hoppy finish. Nothing special, its OK.

Nice pour with a dark red colour. Aroma is coffee like with some notes of fruit. At first drink it doesnt have any specific aftertaste. This changes after the second sip. This is the kind of beer that sneaks up on you which I like. The aftertaste is amazingly long with a nice bitterness that floats in your mouth for quite a while. A nice first encounter.
Pours a nice light amber colour with a medium thick foam. Leaves some lacing on the glass. Flavour is a bit thin and the bitterness is present but not enough.

0, 5 l bottle from Systembolaget, Malmö.
Deep amber colored one with a small but delicious off white head that melt down to a nice lacing one. Toasted nuts, mild herbal hop with some resin in the aroma. Medium bodied beer with caramel and some toasted nuts again. Lively carbonation brings the powerful herbal taste in the finish with some sweet caramel in the aftertaste.

50cl bottle from Systembolaget. Poured dark brown, white frothy head. Aroma is fruity hoppa, yeast and malt. Flavour is fruit, hops and some caramel malt Strong bitter finish, making it an excellent ESB.

Pours clear dark red brown with tanned head leaving beautiful lacing on the entire glass. Aroma is caramel, coffe, malts and fresh baked dark bread. Flavor is pretty much the same as aroma, very nice. Lean and full bodied malty on palate, lovely. Finishes sweetish malty with a long lived tart hoppy aftertaste.

Clear mahogany with frothy tanned head. Fair lacing.
Caramel,old wood, faint herbal aroma. 
Sweet, metallic, bitter. tobacco, acidic in the mouth.
Sticky mouthfeel. 
(0,5 l [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */)

Bottle, 2007-08-08, Göteborg
AP: reddish brown lasting beige/white head
AR: grapes, caramell and coffee
F: roasted malt, caramel, nice bitterness

Pours a dark brown/amber. Nice fluffy off white head. Citrus hop roast malt aroma. Heavy hop flavor with a bit of chocolate. Not overly carbonated.Bitter dry woody aftertaste of licorice chocolate and coffee. Excellent brew. I can see more of these in my future.

Bottle.

Dark brown with a beige head.

Caramel, roasted malt, some fruits. Not bad but not too exciting either.

Bottle from systembolaget.
Pours maroon with a light head.

Rosted malt, toffe and some sweetness. A bit of a light version of an English Barley wine.

Bottle. Pours clear deep amber coloured with a medium sized creamy and lacing off white head. Aromas of caramel, dried fruit, roasted malt and a hint of smoke. Flavours of sweet malt, caramel and a mild hoppy finish.

It poured a very dark amber liquid with a big light brown foam that left a medium amount of lacing. It looked very appealing.

It smelled a bit sour malty if that is even a way of describing it. It also had a scent of something burned and sweet.

It tasted of caramell, malt and with a hint of something sweet and burned. I cant really put my finger on what it tastes like exactly. It was fairly smooth but also left a dry sensation in my mouth.

500 ml bottle, bought at Systembolaget. ABV is 5.8%. Called a "strong pale ale" by the brewery. Dark copper to chestnut colour, moderate beige head. Pleasant aroma of lightly roasted malts, caramel, burnt toast and fruity hops, hints of bakery. In the flavour the fruity hops are well balanced against the malts and moderate roastiness, with a moderately bitter and slightly nutty finish. Good stuff!

Bottle. Reddish brown colour with a beige head. Aroma: roasted/ a bit burned, lightly sour, fruit, citrus, faint rubber, rye bread. Flavor: a bit of sourness and rye bread, sour citrus, fruit, caramel, light roastiness, faint smoke/barnyard, bitter hops.

500ml Bottle (Thanks Gnoff) - Dark brown/red in colour with a foamy beige head. Fruity and roasted aroma with hints of caramel, chocolate and some slightly hoppy elements. Nicely balanced taste with fruit, roasted malt and hops combining very well. Dried fruit, chocolate, caramel, grapefruit and some slightly soapy elements are noticeable. Tasty stuff.
Botella. Deep amber colour. Aroma of well toasted caramel and malt with fruits. Good mouthfeel. Flavour of dark malts, good bitter hoppiness, fruits and caramel.
Pours deep red brown with medium lasting off-white head with some lacing. Aroma of raisins toffee and coffee. Roasted caramel and toffee in flavor. Nicely balanced bitterness. A great brew

Bottle. Dark amber body with a creamy medium off-white head. Bit sweet malty aroma with lots of toffee and caramel. Great balance with the hops. Flavour is malty with some tobacco notes. Again it very balanced as the hops arrives. Medium mouthfeel.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2010 Tested in blind test against three other high-class ales. It has a sweet aroma with a touch of thymes and hops. Taste is rich and round, spices, heavily roasted malts, farmhouse, some acitic hitting before the bitterness comes in. Dynamic taste.

Brought a bottle from Stockholms Systembolaget. Nice sweet and fruity aroma. In taste theres a good balance between malt and hops, long wide aftertaste with mild fruit added with some sweetnes and bitter hops.
Fits very well with lamb.
A bottle at Pikkulintu. Pale brown head. Brown slightly hazy colour. Malty taste. Slightly sour. At the end some hoppy bite.
Hazy dark amber with medium beige head. Somewhat hoppy aroma with roasted malt and caramel. Hoppy flavour with roasted malt, caramel and piney notes. Finished bitter.
Flaske: Flot Brunrød øl. Humlet duft, der går over i en maltet duft som øllen varmes op. Gras er nok meget godt beskrevet, men ellers ikke så interessant. Fin øl og igen høj kvalitet fra Jämtlands.

Bottle, bought at Systembolaget, Malmö. Thank you, Myrup. Pours a great hazel-nutty brown with a fine, creamy, off-white head. Nice duration. Sweet malty aroma, good sweet caramel, some bready notes. Fine hoppiness as well, rather grassy with some pine notes. HIghish carbonation, really fine dry mouthfeel. Flavour is quite chewy malty, lots of caramel and toffee, a touch of liquorice. Really nice hoppiness, almost feels fresh-hopped with a leafy note to it. Dry and bitter aftertaste with roasted and chocolate notes. Great ESB.

Draught @ STBOWF. Stockholm Beer Festival 2008, Sweden.Clear dark orange amber color with a large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, roasted, caramel, moderate to light heavy hoppy, orange. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [270908]

clear amber, thick offwhite head.
niecly hoppy aroma, caramel, sweetness. very nice and full flavor mostly hops, but other nice stuff too. sweetnes, delicious bitterness.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a with a small tan head. Mild roasted and smooth hoppy aroma. Flavour is Mild fruity, hoppy and with a subdued caramel malty base flavour. Light bitterness and fruity lasting finish into the finish. Nice fruity and hoppy finish.
Deep amber colour with medium off-white head.Aroma of rosted malt and bread.Flavor is hoppy with strong bitter finish.

(Bottle at Pikkulintu on 2008-10-30) Deep amber. Clear. Medium sized quite quickly disappearing white head. Hops, little bit of sourness, malts and fruitiness in nose. Full bodied and dryish palate with lot of carbonation. Malts, hops, white bread and bitterness in taste. Bitter aftertaste with some white bread flavours.

500ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Swedish Days 2008)
Deep amber, healthy head. Farmyard aroma. Some mustard heat. Soft, but fairly potent. Tangy.

Brown color with a yeasty haze. Nice thick and still tan head that stays. Light aroma of caramel malt and hints of flowers and soap. Flavor of lightly roasted malt and a well balanced hop-bitter finish.
500 ml bottle. Slightly hazy reddish brown colour, thin off-white head. Sweet malty aroma with orange and some hops. Sweet roated malty flavour, strong bitter finish.

Ruby brown color with small off-white head. Fresh caramely and slightly roasty malty and hoppy aroma. Flavor is sweet,  slightly roasty malty and nicely bitter in the end. Almost full-bodied and oily palate.
Bottle 0,5l. Dark brown colored. An OK creamy tanned head. Aroma of caramel. Dry fruity flavor transforming into a sherry-like aftertaste with notes of nuts. Well rounded. KI=7
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are flowers, malt and hops. Good bitter finish.

One of the best so far from Jämtlands. Great ESB with lots of flavours typical for the type. Caramel, toffee, maybe some orange in there too. You really can tell this beer is unpastorised, it is really, really rich in the flavours.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2009 50 cl bottle - Dark copper bronze color with a big nice head. Strong notes malt and orange-citrus in the aroma. Flavor is filled again by strong malts very nicely balanced with a smooth english bitterness. Nicely done by Jämtlands!

Bottle. Pours dark bronze with a medium head. Grassy hop aroma balancing caramel sweetness. Flavours are balanced towards bitterness, though still letting some toffee character shine through. Well-made.
Damn its good ESB. Sweet bitter -great balance. medium body refreshing. sourness and a bit woody.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2009 Bottle. Dark brown color, mediumsized brown head. Fruiy, nutty aroma with caramel and some light citrusy hops. Flavour is quite malty with clear caramel notes, some fruitiness and hoppy citrus notes. Finish is bitter. Body is medium, texture is slightly oily. Good, but not great.
Bottle. Reddish brown colour with an almost white head. Nice malts on the nose with caramel and some fruity notes. A bit piney. Flavour malty - caramel with a distict bitterness.

Bottle @ Craig´s, november 07. Clear, glowing ruby with some brown hues and a small white rim. Crystal malts with some toasted and nutty flavors and a fruity ending. Fruity, cereal aroma with some caramel notes. Medium mouthfeel, malt richness with a nice bittersweet aftertaste. Nice, nutty english ale.

Large and dense lightly tanned head, mostely lasting. Body is plain brown colored and well corbonatied. Modest aroma of chocolate and caramellish malts. Whiffs of fruit and fresh, dusty hops. Dry malty taste with a gente hopbitterness and som nice undertones of acidic fruits and mild coffee. A tasty and harmonious bitter.

A Mes rate: 50cl bottle at Casper’s Christmas Cracker.Thanks to Jenny for this one. Mid transluscent brown with a thin off white head. Nice roasty malt aroma with delicate notes of tobacco, yeast, coffee, yeast and spice. Lovely sourness in the flavour. Tangy malt, tart dry hops and a really clean bitter hop finish. Swift but satisfying finish. Really interesting and unusual.
Bottle with Mes & tashi. Cloudy brown appearance. Sour flavour with an orange tang. Aroma similar and palate is smooth. Tasty stuff but not an ESB!
Lighter rust colored. Good head. Small hint of hop in the nose with some malt. Very good hop character, and slightly woody.

50cl bottle from Systembolaget.   Deep chestnut brown with a thick and lasting beige head and plenty of sediment suspended.   The aroma is earthy and slightly citrusy hops with some caramel and toasty malt to back it up.   The flavor is sadly not as nice.   there is a persistent sourness that almost tastes like it could be from the hops, but could be lactic as well.   Bordering on undrinkable, but there are still good qualities.   The beer underneath this has a nice mellow maltiness, but the acidity kills it.   the body is full and the carbonation is soft.   Im a little bummed by the off flavors here, as I really like most of Jämtlands beers, but this one tastes stale.
Bottle at home with Fukito... Copper ... fruit hop ... sweet toffee malts some hops ... little drying touch bitter linger.
50 cl bottle. Little sedimentas at the bottom. Dark amber colour with a huge whiet head. Aroma of caramel. Little sour flavour with notes of hops, bitter and quite dry at the end.

Bottle. Dark brown body colour topped by a lasting, beige head blanketing the glass. Attractive aromatic hops and a slightly smell of sweet malts. Profound hoppy character supported by notes of dark fruits developing into a pleasant bitter finish. Well bodied (Thanks to CinnamonGirl for the taste, Sommarøya 18.08.2007).

Courtesy of Marsiblursi.  The aroma holds low key dark fruit aroma with mild toasted malt notes and very faint smokey notes. The body is a ruddy brown and holds a diminishing tan head. Fruit, mild caramel, toasted malts again with very faint smoky notes. Has a fruity, lightly tart finish.
Dark reddish brown with little head and some lacing. Slightly roasty, hoppy aroma. Medium to full mouthfeel with a solid, pleasant roastiness balanced by rounded hops.
Bottle. Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized offwhite head. Quite refreshing with notes of hops, berries, malts and grass.
Bottle (Lars) at The Club !! Clear red/brown - offwhite head. Nice hoppy/berries/malty aroma. Taste: Light sweet malty, berries, medium hoppy, dry grass. Sharp. Sweet/dry/bitter finish.
Pours a slightly hazy brown with an off-white diminishing head. Fresh with a hoppy sourness. Also aromas of gooseberries. Hints of plastic. Light bodied. Sharp bitter finish.
bottle. amber color with medium head. fresh slightly hoppy aroma. malts and some hops in taste.

Deep copper pour, solid off-white head that is certainly not shy on the lacing. Profoundly toasted nose comprises soft raisin, grainy, pear-like, rather salty sea air, so generally fruity, but toast dominated maltiness. Very well integrated, every sip invites to the next one, really, Im disappointed it disappears so fast. Rather earthy flavor profile, floral, spicey hops adding the depth that makes it confusing on top of pure. Rather citric in its growing, sheet-like bitterness that starts stoney and grows grapefruity and rind-like. Solid long finish. Enough of everything to support the rest.
Bottle. A bit cloudy red brown body. Small fluffy head. Light fruity aroma. Heavy flavour, with alcohol, some fruits and some sweetness. Pleasant finish. Too fizzy carbonation. (Ånn, 02.04.07)
Bottle. Off-white creamy and lasting head. Clear brown body. Caramel malt aroma with notes of cocoa. Caramel honey coriander flavor with a bit of hops.
Bottle. Dark amber colour with particles floating around. Tan head. Aroma of caramel and some hops. A bit sour hoppy flavour, medium bitterness.

Bottle. Clear copper color with thick off-white head that slowly disappears. Piney, citric hop aromas with some earthy roasted malts. Medium bodied. Very bitter flavour, somewhat acidic, and the beer needed to warm up a bit for the malt character to come through the heavy wall of bitterness.
rbesg06, bottle at delirium. dark reddish brown, soft white head. fresh, biscuity aroma, lightly floral. slightly toffeed, moderate bitterness, very drinkable

0.5 l bottle. Red color with creamy head. Sweetish aroma with dark caramel and parfumy, candy-like english hops. Strongly caramelly and malty flavor with light bitterness and some english hop flavor. Better when warms up and CO2 dissipates.

Beautiful red-brown with a nice, creamy head. The aroma is round and vary complex with notes of fruit and roasted malt. The flavour has initially fruit and roasted malt, but then comes notes of flower and a hint of chocolate and nice bitter hops. Nice and balanced.

500 ml bottle. Dark ruby red with a thick off-white head. Nutty and slightly roasted malt aroma. Prickling sensation when it enters the mouth. More of the roasted malt to be found in the flavour. Raspberry-like, but it is the roasted characters that dominate. Crisp bitterness throughout. Finishes with a sharp bitterness. Could have done without some of the harsher edges, but this is overall a really nice ESB.
Darught at the Rover in Göteborg with Gnoff. Aroma not too strong. Very fascinating chili-chocolate taste, good finish as well.

Being English and living in Sweden, this is the perfect hybrid beer for me - the best of both worlds!

Pours a clear chestnut amber with a thick vanilla off-white head.

Aroma: Heres where it gets funky. Fresh citrus fruits (particularly grapefuit) and grass.

Flavour: Fantastic balance between spritzy hops and a malty mouthfeel (knäckerbröd - crispbread). A soft bitterness and orchards full of fruit.

Palate: Oh I love this - smoother than a Barry White love song.

Overall: Hides its alcoholic colours very well and has all the merits of an ESB without any obvious roasted malt but rather a clean fruity knockout punch.

(Bottle) Dark amber colour with mahogany hints, foamy beige head. Fruity nose with dried fruit, prunes, orange peel, chocolate, dark rye bread and a fresh leafy hop aroma. Fruity, slightly roasted, taste with dried fruit, caramel, chocolate and a nice, deep, earthy bitterness in the finish. Lovely beer with lots of character.

Complements of Madsberg. Expirey end of this month. Pours a medium reddish brown, with lots of off-white head and thick lace. Significant malt and citrus aroma. Very easy drinking, with good hopped dryness, dried fruit, nuts and spice. A very good ESB.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, malt. Flavour is hop, roasted, caramel. Light roasted and bitter finish.

Aroma: good hops, sweet malt, some sourishness, some rowan, dark knäckebröd.    
 Appearance: brown like raisins that colors the white head a bit.  Flavor: bitter, slightly burnt, caramellike flavor, dry afterbitterness, very vague sourish aftertaste too.  Palate: dry, a bit chemical, slimy, old.
Bottle. Well, another mediocre bitter from Jämtlands.. there are no surprises here. Pasteurized, filtered, carbonated.. or so it tastes anyhow.

(Bottle BB 10/2006) Hoppy (flowers) and caramel aroma. Red brown colour, very slightly sparkling and very small, white, fully diminishing head with a hint of lacing. Sweet, caramel, slightly roasted malty and moderately bitter flavour. Softly carbonated and medium bodied palate with a hint of alcohol. Very tasty bitter! 20/08/06

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2006 Pours a beautiful clear dark copper with a creamy off-white head. Toffee, caramel and some earthy and floral hops in the aroma. The body has a solid bitterness, with some floral hops combining with some caramel malts. It has a much fuller feel and bitterness to it than the Pilgrim. The finish is a little grainy and bitter. Great bitter.

Bottled. Dark brown in colour.creamy beige head. It has a bitter juniper berry like aroma with burnt malt as well. The flavour has a strong influence of burnt malt. there is a bitterness in the flavour as well. It has a dry and sweet aftertaste.
Aroma is wierd like roasted yet really hoppy. Taste is complex with a great bitter bite, a good dry finish also.
This is a very good bitter, full bodied  with a long aftertaste.A lot of hops !

50 cl bottle at Bishops Arms in Sundsvall, Sweden. Dark reddish brown color, big tan creamy head. Hoppy and a bit fruity scent, a little bit burnt smell as well. Burnt taste, but not overwhelming at all. Fruity after taste. Medium mouthfeel and high bitterness.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2007 (Bottle at home, Göteborg) Pours red to black/brown with a sandy-coloured head. Aroma of chocolate, sweet toffee and malt. Some hoppy notes. Metallic and some liqourice. Dried fruits.
Flavour of coffee and salt with some toffé-notes. Roasted. Hints of chocolate and liquorice. It has an attack bitterness that doesn´t linger. A bit dry and sourish. One of Jämtlands finets, but even better on draught.

(500 ml bottle: Obtained 01-Mar-06 in trade with bogdi1, thanks Juha!) This is a gorgeous-looking beer, but sadly, thats the high point.  Medium-brown in color with nearly perfect clarity, the miniscule bubbles can be seen rising slowly toward the surface.  The billowy tan head is lively and long-lasting, settling to and maintaining a quarter-inch foamy layer for the entire session.  Unfortunately, Im getting a bit of apple skins in the otherwise lightly roasty nose, and thats one of the flaws I find most intolerable.  But while the crisp, red apple skins are present in the flavor as well, most notably in the finish, theres a significant enough roasty component that the apples are less prominent and intrusive.  The mildly sweet beer is only lightly bitter, but also quite dry and dusty in flavor and on the palate.  Carbonation is moderate.  I think the apple skins are masking some of the flavor components, so overall, this beer is drinkable, but thats as far as Ill go

Golden brown with red shine, nice light brown head, quite fast away leaving some laces; simple malty sweet nose that lacks depth: molasses, grain, boring; simple body with balance and very little character; into bitter and a little sour finish with mostly malt and again a bit sweet. it isnt exactly bad, it is just super boring.

50cl - thanks MrWalker - Best Before 05/06 - Aroma is earthy with sweet malts, carmel, and subtle hops.  Pours rudy red with a huge head and great lacing.  Flavor matches aroma with the hops coming on a bit stronger.  Palate is tart with enough sweetness to make it very enjoyable.  A tasty brew.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2006 Bottle,dark red colour, with a nice creamy foam.
A nice maltyness and a nice bitterness and cidrik in the end.
. This is a a beer I want to taste a lots of times in the future!
I have now change the rating notes, adn the beer has moore maltyness and balanced bitternes overall. So therefore I gave it a higher score.
Werry nice Pale Ale.
Bottle at Reading 2006 (Sunday) - thanks Duff. Ruby coloured. Malty aroma. Boiled sweets and malt aroma, demerara sugar, caramel and raisins, not too much bitterness. Tasted a bit stale.

Big beige head that’s creamy round the side and coarse-laced in the middle. Dark red body. Sweetish malty lightly roasted aroma with strong resin/pepper hop aroma. Sweet hoppy roasty taste, slightly watery, with hoppy malty, burnt aftertaste. Notes of licorice and grain. Unusual, but nice.
Molasses qand toasted grain comined with grapefruity hop aroma and bitterness. Almost creamy finish, while the hops linger. A great beer!

Bottle, at home.
Brown with light brown head, almost diminishing, good lacings. Aroma moderate malty (burnt, caramel) and hoppy (flowery). Flavor moderate sweet and bitter, long duration. Light to medium body, oily, soft carbonated.
Bottled. Brown with a small beige head. Fruity aroma with some hoppiness. Light flavor of fruits (citrus) and hops. Nice American-hoppy finish. (051104)

Bottled. Clear red colour. Medium, off-white head. Spicy, citrus fruity aroma with a chocolatey, roastmalty background. Quite dry, malty, toffeish. Citrus fruity. Finishes hop-bitter and dry. Really good. Thanks to MrWalker for this.
Dark amber, almoust red. Toffee in aroma and sweet malt. Burnt robust malt. Also little peppry in the end.

(Bottle 50 cl) Beautiful, deep bronze colour with a delicate head leaving lots of pretty laces. Has an odd bon-bon-like aroma. And a bit of the same in the flavour. Not overly sweet or cloying or exactly unpleasant, just strange. But another welcome Swedish version of an ale. 230302

Nice copper color with a small head. Aroma is malt, cinnamon, pepper, coriander and all-spice. Taste is sweet with caramel, coffee, lime peel and zesty hops. A nice change from esbs that taste like dough. Thanks to Clark for leaving this in my fridge.

(500ml bottle, best by 10/05) Crystal clear dark brown body with a healthy beige head.  Aroma is medium sweet, caramel, raisin, spice, orange/floral.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, orange/floral, spice, some raisin.  Soft medium body.

Bottle. Dusty, chalky aroma. Brown colour. Unstable, creamy light brown head. Peppery flavour. The alcohol dominates, but it is also quite malty. Some hoppiness. Dry, roast barley, coffeeish aftertaste.
Brown reddish colour with a fast disappearing beige head. Malty and light hoppy aroma with hints of caramel and nuts. Fruity and caramel sweet flavor with a dry hoppy finish.
Red brown colour with a baige head. Malty caramel aroma and taste, light hoppy. Medium body and a light sweet dry finish.

Bottled.
Orange brown coloured with a fast disappearing off white head.
Malty aroma with notes of caramel and hops.
Nice malty flavour with notes of fruits, caramel and hops.

Bottled
Copper brown, small brown head. Flowery hops in the nose, well-balanced bitterness in the flavor. Good balanced bitter.

Brown/redish colour. Thin head.
Ale-ish fruity and sweet. Clear hoppy flavour and great bitterness.
Keg @ The Ardbeg Room, StockholmLively hop aroma. Caramel and chocolate dominant.Quite complex and unusually hoppy. Still sweet aftertaste.

Bottle. Mahogany with tight tan head. Hoppy aroma with malty and caramelly flavor. Some light roasted notes and a hint of smoke. The bitterness is perfect, and you want to take another sip instantly. Excellent subdued carbonation and good mouthfeel, although a bit watery. Strangely enough it leaves the mouth a bit dry - like eating peanut butter from the jar - but still an excellent beer, that I would definitely buy again.
Dark brown, small white head. Sweet malty aroma. Taste of hops and caramel-sweetness, the aftertaste is a bit roasty. Wellbalanced beer. Medium bitter.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2005 Bottle. Brown with small off-white head. Caramel, resinous, earthy, medium-high bitterness. Medium bodied. Well balanced. Re-rate: malt and hops in delicious balance - Jamtlands should be in Denamrk.
Bottle. Dark dark reddish brown colour. Long lasting head. Abit sweet malty aroma. Lots of hops in the taste and some roasted taste. Nice bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle - 500ml. Dark brown body with reddish glints. Diminishing off-white bubbly head. Nice hoppy aroma with relatively strong spicy notes. Taste dominated by hops. There are also some roasty and herbal notes. Ends with a long and nice bitter finish. Very good stuff!

Red-brown beer, some haze; rapidly dwindling yellowish head. Dark chocolate, chalk and something like drainwater - little nose, chocolate malts dominate. Little hint of hops all the same, after much searching. Bitter, very hoppy flavour, blending with a sweeter, chocolate taste, hence bitter chocolate - or bitter grapes as the hops are quite fruity in flavours. Ends a bit harsh. Medium bodied, moderate burning (not alcohol). Another good one by Jämtlands, again I wonder at the ESB designation. This time, Id say old ale.

(Bottled) Clear, dark amber color with small head. Somewhat sweet, quite mild and malty aroma. Strongly aromatic-hoppy and sweetish flavor with roasted maltiness and some toffee-oaky character. Smooth, quite warming, oily and slicky palate with low carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2004 Bottle. The colour is not very pale, but deep copper red. The medium-sized foam with medium-sized bubbles builds a little crater. The liquid is clear. 

The generous smell is loaded with lots of somewhat burned malt and a somewhat sourish flavour of hops. Challenger? Probably.

The carbonation is mild and pleasant. I like!

There is an almost sour taste in the start, but a potent sweet malty aroma soon replaces it. The growing and very balanced bitterness fades quickly, making this beer surprisingly easy to drink.

This is most defiantly a Strong Pale Ale in taste, but it is also a very typical brew from Jämtlands Bryggeri with their trademark blend of hops (Challenger and Bramling Cross). Indeed a great pale ale!

Bottled
Pine and citrus aromahops for the nose.
Brown, low foamy head.
Roasted coffe and nutty flavors with a strong aromahop (pine citrus) counterpoint.
Medium body - sparkly mouthfeel.
Very pleasant.
Strawberry cooky like fruity aroma.... Slightly complex taste... Nice round bitter finish...

Foamy lasting tan head on a amber colored body. Mainly sweet malty and spicy aroma with toffee and nut tones. Flavor is bitter hoppy with plenty of spices such as pepper, nutmeg, herbs and citrus. Dry finish. Jämtland definately does it again with this flavorfull bitter! 
Thanks rickgordon for the trade!
Deep dark amber coloured. Nice aroma with hops, strawberries and some peaches. Sweet and fruity flavour with notes of coffee. Bitter finish.

Bottled: Dark amber coloured. Thin beige harmonious head. Long lasting. Hops, flowers and sweetness in the aroma. Light chocolate, hops, fruitiness and some sweetness in the flavour. Nice bitterness with some fruity notes in the aftertaste. This is a very good one.
Dark golden with anice head. Aroms is fruity, from orange, and bitter. Some coffee in the finish. A good one

Sometimes its hard to find a Bitter like this even in the British Isles!
Very bitter and fruity, but with a bigger body than most bitters.
The aroma is slightly sweet. The color is amber and the head is fantastic. The flavor is sweet with an OK bitterness. A really good beer.

(Stockholm Beer Festival 2003)
Dark golden. Has a nice sweet and hoppy aroma. Flavir is sweet but turns into some bitterness. Some citrus. A good one.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2007 Nice dark brown/ruby color with good creamy head. Delicius aroma of spices, roasted coffee, dried dark fruit and of course, Hops. Taste is very smooth and tasty, chocolate, citrus, herbs, nuts with earthy notes. Finishes bitter with some woody and earthy notes.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2005 July 2003. One of the best for the style: spicy, chocolately, coffeeish, citric, nutty and very hoppy. Skal! [4.8]
October 2004. My dad brought me from Sweden some Jamtlands beers, including two Postiljons... Unfortunately, its lost much of its complexity and become more flat with coffee+cola dominating taste. Hops are still all right. [3.9]
Yeasty and biscuity for a bitter, with a lively carbonated body. Malts are soft and light ending with a nice orangey bitterness.

RBSG2003
Crystal clear mohogany with a big, everlasting, off-white head. Decent lacing.
The aroma is yeasty and soapy with notes of fuzzy fruit, toffee and Wonder bread.
The flavor is very well-balanced. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. Lengthy, astringent, lightly bitter finish.

A deep copper color.  An initial malt aroma followed by subtle, but present, hops.  The flavor, again, started with nice malt.  Biscuit, caramel, toffee and a bit of nut.  The bitter citrus in the finish rounds out a nice Swedish bitter.  Thanks to hopsrus for sharing, and to omhper for giving him the opportunity.  A wonderful surprise over the Rate Beer weekend.

Dark amber.
Fruity aroma, like elder-tree.
Quite lively with flavour from caramel and chocolate.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2005  Bottled. 
Clear dark-ish brown colour. Rich malty nose, with a great hop profile along with caramel and a slight smokiness. Roasty notes in flavour, almost leaning towards a dunkel/schwarzbier, but with a gentle caramel note. Really dry. More than solid!

Color of maple syrup, transluscent and with a head that covers the glass. Aroma of citrus and nuts.  This would make a great session beer.  A little more bitter than the typical bitter.  Dry hoppy finish.  Good Brew, Thanks Per
Lighter rust colored. Good head. Small hint of hop in the nose with some malt. Very good hop character, and slightly woody.
Was an ESB, I'm told, but now the label says "Strong Pale Ale"--and the taste reflects the average of the two.  Hoppy complexion, but mild with some odd elements in the end.  Decent bitter end.

Bottle courtesy of Ompher,rich charcol red color, wonderful roasted almond aroma. almost no carbonation and no lace, perfect finish with hops just enough to have sligh bitter to balance out the sweet flavor.
Unusual, a little bit too bitter and crisp for me.  Per says that it used to be an ESB...not all that flavorful but still drinkable.  Cool label!
Reddish-brown in color, slightly cloudy.  Very clean and crisp in the taste.  Sweet maltiness and notes of plum and bittering hops led to a somewhat dry finish.
This one is my Jamtlands favorite: dry and herbal amber ale. It no longer is called ESB. It has become Strong Pale Ale.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2004 2004-03-05, 8-5-7-3-14=37Brown-amber color; creamy head. Very nice hoppy aroma. Good hoppy taste, a bit malty, too much caramel.2002-11-14, 8-5-7-5-16=41Dark red-amber color, misty, nice head. Nice hop aroma, more equilibrate than <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Ratings/Beer/Beer-Rat Pilgrim Ale. Good mix of malt, roasted malt and hop; pretty dry, but less than <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Ratings/Beer/Beer-Rat Pilgrim Ale, also less strong final, anyway really good.

Crystal clear dark amber with a small off white medium lasting head. Light fruity caramel and mild bitter roasted malt aroma. Interesting spicey slightly smokey roasted caramel flavours. Medium to thin Bitter styled body with decent bitter palate. Medium bitter finish and aftertaste. Easily up there and maybe a touch better even that the Fullers bitters.
Dark cloudy, copper coloured beer with a small head.The flavour is spicy, yeasty with a dry bitter finish.
dark red-brown colour, fine head, nice lace, very impressive aroma of spices, chocolate and chessnuts, the sweetness is balanced by a nice bitterness, long alcohol and spicy finish

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2009 Bottled:Pours dark reddish brown  with a small head. Sourish and peaty aroma. Slightly roasted flavour with notes of bitter almonds, smoke and sour peat. Somethings not right here.

Much darker than I expected.  Firm maltiness,with a decent amount of malt complexity, as it warms the hops come up and become quite perfumy.   Definitely some fuggles here.  Low carbonation, but that suits the style.  Pretty good, thanks PsychProf.

Chestnut brown color with a vanilla cream soda colored head. A moderate amount of lace.A very malty and nutty aroma with an extremely sweet flavor that moves quite quickly to a rather snappy hop bitterness. The beer then ends where it began, with a sweet finish, thus it drove palate a little batty. I also picked up the taste of unsalted cashews.
A very nice ESB, good combination of malt and hops and nice satisfying hop finish, and zesty, fresh and just plain tasty, very nice, once again per, a great brew.

Impressive visually; nice deep red, beautiful head, very sticky. Hop aromatic from the outset. I dont get the malt balance that the others here report; this seems to be less English-style than other bitters, less mild, but I defer to others with vastly more experience than me. Seems like a cross between a bitter and a hopped-up American Amber from the West Coast, such as Speakeasys Prohibition. Very good. Thanks, Per.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Deep burgundy coloured, nice firm head. Really big chocolate aroma. Hints of orange and coffee. Big, malty body. Medium sweet and lingering balanced bitterness. Yet another solid beer from Jämtlands Bryggeri.
More chocolately than desired really, too firm body. Sturdy bitterness worthy a genuine ESB, but lacks the touch that make you have more ... and more

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2005 Red-orange-brown with decent head.
Soapy aroma with notes of perfume, citrus, carmel and chocolate.
Roasted flavor with notes of smoke and chocolate. A bit acidic. Hoppy notes and a decent bitter finish

Vvery dark amber in colour, with a robust nose showing chocolatey, coffeeish malt undertones and herbal notes. 
The body is firm, the finish soft and malty, with hop aromatics.  Complex and flavourful, this is another fine
beer from a consistently excellent brewery.  This ESB deserves a little cask-conditioning.
